ul.li: kernel 2.4.x is officially deprecated in Gentoo/AMD64
gcc 3.3 is officially deprecated in 2004.3 for amd64 only
sys-kernel/gentoo-dev-sources is the only supported kernel sources on Gentoo/AMD64
Firewire support will break if you enable kernel preemption in newer kernels (>=2.6.4)
A dual 32-bit/64-bit environment is possible, with some limitations
NEVER add x86 or ~x86 to your ACCEPT_KEYWORDS
NEVER use -Os in your CFLAGS on the AMD64 platform
Pass idle=poll to the kernel at boot if you are getting kernel panics
MPT Fusion SCSI cards require iommu=merge to be passed to the kernel at boot time
You must have IA32 Emulation turned on in Executable File Formats in your kernel for 32-bit emulation (and 32-bit chroot) to work
OpenOffice must be installed from binaries (openoffice-bin), a 64-bit version is currently not available
The Livecd doesn't autodetect 3Com 3c940 network chips, you have to manually modprobe sk98lin
